meanings.definition: The process by which organic substances are broken down by living organisms.
meanings.sent1: Biodegradations help nature recycle waste materials.
meanings.sent2: The biodegradations of leaves in the forest enrich the soil.
meanings.sent3: The party theme was 'biodegradations' where guests brought compostable gifts.
meanings.sent4: The biodegradations of time slowly transform fallen trees into fertile soil.
meanings.sent5: In the garden, you can witness the magic of biodegradations turning scraps into nutrients.

meanings.definition: The breaking down of materials through natural processes.
meanings.sent1: Understanding biodegradations is crucial for environmental conservation.
meanings.sent2: The biodegradations of plastic take hundreds of years to complete.
meanings.sent3: The artist's sculpture symbolized the beauty of biodegradations in art.
meanings.sent4: The biodegradations of memories can sometimes be bittersweet.
meanings.sent5: The power of biodegradations in the ecosystem is truly remarkable.
